did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Israel Cohen Papers relating to his book collection,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Notes and ephemera connected with the book collection that Stanford Libraries bought. Includes correspondence and publications. The collection is particularly strong in Jewish, Israeli, and Zionist history, dictionaries, encyclopedias,and books in the field of Hebrew language; translations into Hebrew of world literature; and most importantly, Hebrew literature, both ancient and modern.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: All materials described in this finding aid are available for use without restriction.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Israel Cohen Papers relating to his book collection, M1001. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography / Administrative History
bioghist.p: Israeli publisher and editor. Cohen was born in Galicia in 1905. He was a book lover all his life. He chaired Israel's Union of Hebrew Writers and published hundreds of articles of literary criticism. He died in 1986.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Notes and ephemera connected with the book collection that Stanford Libraries bought. Includes correspondence and publications. The collection is particularly strong in Jewish, Israeli, and Zionist history, dictionaries, encyclopedias,and books in the field of Hebrew language; translations into Hebrew of world literature; and most importantly, Hebrew literature, both ancient and modern.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Association materials: Materials pertaining to various associations to which Cohen belonged and committees on which he served.
Most of the academic committees on which Cohen served are dedicated to the preservation and advancement of the Hebrew language.
Materials pertaining to various academic associations to which Cohen belonged and committees on which he served; most are dedicated to the preservation and advancement of the Hebrew language.
The civic associations to which Cohen belonged are dedicated to such matters as the naming of streets in Tel Aviv.
Materials pertaining to various civic associations to which Cohen belonged and committees on which he served; they are dedicated to such matters as naming streets in Tel Aviv.
This includes a committee to memorialize Akiva Govrin and activities of AHIAM, an organization dedicated to the preservation and advancement of Israeli culture.

Materials pertaining to various cultural associations to which Cohen belonged and committees on which he served; these include a committee to memorialize Akiva Govrin and activities of AHIAM, an organization dedicated to the preservation and advancement of Israeli culture.
Meeting minutes and other materials pertaining to various political associations to which Cohen belonged.
Materials pertaining to the activities of the Union of Hebrew Writers.
Materials pertaining to the activities of the Union of Hebrew Writers.
Form letters from various religious organizations such as Chabad and the American Jewish Committee
Form letters from various religious organizations such as Chabad and the American Jewish Committee.
Two bibliographies: Maamare Feytlson (5 p.) and Bibliyografyah shel kitve profesor Shmuel Werses, by Rut Shenpeled (9 p.)
Two bibliographies: Maamare Feytlson (5 p.) and Bibliyografyah shel kitve profesor Shmuel Werses, by Rut Shenpeled (9 p.)
Partial copies of books whose condition does not warrant preservation and/or provenance does not warrant cataloging.
Partial copies of books whose condition and/or provenance does not warrant preservaton or cataloging.
Partial copies of books whose condition and/or provenance does not warrant preservaton or cataloging.
Partial copies of books whose condition and/or provenance does not warrant preservaton or cataloging.
Partial copies of books whose condition and/or provenance does not warrant preservaton or cataloging.
Cardstock bookmarks given away by publishers and other scraps of paper used to mark pages.
Cardstock bookmarks given away by publishers and other scraps of paper used to mark pages.
Compliments slips (review copy inserts): Printed cards, form letters, and notes from authors inserted into review copies of books.
Printed cards, form letters, and notes from authors inserted into review copies of books. Many include title page photocopies of the books they accompanied.
Printed cards, form letters, and notes from authors inserted into review copies of books. Many include title page photocopies of the books they accompanied.
Printed cards, form letters, and notes from authors inserted into review copies of books. Many include title page photocopies of the books they accompanied.
Correspondence: Miscellaneous correspondence from the 1930s to the 1960s, most not addressed to or signed by Israel Cohen.
Miscellaneous correspondence from the 1930s to the 1960s, mainly not addressed to or signed by Israel Cohen.
Miscellaneous correspondence from the 1970s and 1980s; some not addressed to or signed by Israel Cohen.
Miscellaneous undated notes and correspondence.
Contains greeting cards and invitations.
Greeting cards and invitations; mainly not personal in nature.

Israeli ephemera (miscellaneous): Printed matter pertaining to Israeli life in the 1960s to the 1980s, much of which apparently served as bookmarks. Of particular interest is a menu for a dinner honoring Prime Minister Golda Meir at the Sheraton-Tel Aviv Hotel, July 30th, 1969.

Miscellaneous printed material pertaining to Israeli life in the 1960s to the 1980s, much of which apparently served as bookmarks. Of particular interest is a menu for a dinner honoring Prime Minister Golda Meir at the Sheraton-Tel Aviv Hotel, July 30th, 1969.
Three typed catalogs, two in German, one in Hebrew, listing books available at the library of the cultural center of the embassy of the Federal Republic of Germany. All dated 1977.
Three typed catalogs, two in German, one in Hebrew, listing books available at the library of the cultural center of the embassy of the Federal Republic of Germany. All dated 1977.
Collection of maps of Israel and other parts of the world. Many were printed as newspaper supplements and given free to subscribers.
Collection of maps of Israel and other parts of the world. Many were printed as newspaper supplements and given free to subscribers.
Collection of maps of Israel and other parts of the world. Many were printed as newspaper supplements and given free to subscribers.
Collection of maps of Israel and other parts of the world. Many were printed as newspaper supplements and given free to subscribers.

Names and addresses on business cards and on scraps of paper torn from envelopes.
Materials clipped or removed from newspapers.

Studies of the weekly Torah portion (parshah) by Nehama Leibowitz.

Printed booklets, arranged according to the five books of the bible: Bereshit [In the Beginning]; Shemot [Exodus]; Vayikra [Leviticus]; Bamidbar [Numbers]; and Devarim [Deuteronomy]. Each booklet consists of a study of the weekly Torah portion (parshah) by Nehama Leibowitz. Most are in Hebrew; the few in English are translated and adapted by Aryeh Newman.

Includes photographs and postcards of Theodore Herzl and other figures from Israeli history as well as art reproductions that accompanied art show announcements or that were included as supplements to newspaper subscribers.

Contents include photographs and postcards of Theodore Herzl and other figures from Israeli history as well as art reproductions that accompanied art show announcements or that were included as supplements to newspaper subscribers.

Contents include photographs and postcards of Theodore Herzl and other figures from Israeli history as well as art reproductions that accompanied art show announcements or that were included as supplements to newspaper subscribers.
Event programs relating to all aspects of Israeli life.
Programs from the many Israeli arts performances Cohen attended.

Three programs: The Paul Taylor Dance Company [appearing at Israel Festival Caesarea 1966], July 27-August 27, 1966;Shlonsk: lehakat ha-folkor ha-mamlakhtit shel polin be-mahol uve-zemer, September 17, 1966; Inbal: teatron mahol, undated ca. 1975.

Six programs: Gertrude Holt, coloratora mezzo-soprano, June 8, 1958;Yiftah [Jephtha], G.F. Handel, The Moshe Zadikov Choir and Symphonic Orchestra, January 18, 1962;Israel Festival, 1963; Gala opening, July 16 - August 12, 1963;ha-Akademyah ha-yisraelit le-musikah be-Tel Aviv, Shavua ha-musikah ha-yisraelit, December 22, 1965; Moadon Milo, tselilim min ha-avar, introduced by Israel Cohen, May 1, 1973;80 yor moderne yidishe muzik, June 22, 1980

Thirteen Israel National Opera programs: Faust; Alexandra; Kiss Me, Kate!; La Perichole; Aida; Tales of Hoffmann; Samson and Delilah [two copies]; Andrea Chenier; Eugene Onegin; Un Ballo in Maschera; Adriana Levouvreur; Otello; Aida; 1958 - 1974

Ten Teatron ha-Bimah programs: Per gint; ha-Erev Ionesco; Daber elai bi-veradim; Billy badai; Itsik Vitenberg; Nashe vindzor ha-alizot; Arturo Ui; Tartuffe; Shesh nefashot mehapsot mehaber; Mi yatsil et ha-falah; undated, ca. 1960s and 1970s.

Fourteen Teatron ha-Bimah programs: Bi-kets ha-yamim; Natan ha-hakham; Pegishah al ha-gevul; ha-Parisait; Masa le-niniveh; ha-Shekhunah; Komedyah shel tauyot; ha-Em; Per gint; Medeah; Pandre ha-gibor; ha-Ahim Karamazov; Retsah he-hapim mi-pesha; dated and undated, 1950s.

Eleven Teatron ha-Bimah programs: Lizistratah; Bikur ha-geveret ha-zekenah; Adon Biderman; Nitsots shel meshorer; Habet ahorah bi-zaam; ha-etsim metit zekufim; Bet ha-bubot; ha-Soher mi-Venetsyah; ha-Dod Vanyah; ha-Masa ha-arokh le-tokh ha-lailah; Nisuav shel ha-adon Misisipi; dated and undated, 1950s and 1960s.

Eight Teatron ha-Bimah programs: Milhamah ve-shalom; Beket o kevodo shel elohim; Hinaniyot ha-stav; ha-Beitsah; Anah kristi; Hezyonot Simon Mashar; Rekviem le-nezirah; Oliver; dated and undated, 1950s and 1960s.
Seven Teatron ha-Bimah programs: ha-Kisot; Tango; Shavru et ha-kelim; ha-Rotshim ha-ketanim: Komedyah; ha-Kayits; Dodah Lizah; Shimshon; dated and undated, 1960s.
Five Teatron ha-Bimah programs: Izun adin; Akidat Yosef; ha-Shahaf; Kolomb; Yehude ha-demamah; dated and undated, 1970s.
Five Teatron ha-Bimah programs: Halokh hazor; Troylus ve-Kresidah; Me-ever la-gevulin; Al kalut-daat ve-tseviyut; ha-Tiyul; dated and undated, 1970s and 1980.
Seven Teatron ha-Kameri programs: ha-Drakon; Mehumah rabah al lo davar; Gibor ha-yom; En berirah le-hobson; Voytshek; Kineret kineret; Pigmalyon; Mari Styuart; dated and undated; 1950s and 1960s.

Thirteen Teatron Ohel programs: ha-Poemah ha-pedagogit; Naarah la-ruah; Misrah tovah; Targil be-hamesh etsbaot; ha-Shabat ha-shehorah; Od nahar ehad; Hashmalit u-shemah teshukah; He-yadata et netiv ha-halav; ha-Ketubah; Kesher dam; Mar slon yekirenu; Shanim yemin; shanim smol; ha-Kad ha-shavur; dated and undated, 1950s and 1960s.

Eleven Teatron Ohel programs: ha-Perait; Adam hu adam; ha-Kamtsan; Hofre ha-zahav; Shorashim; Bet kevarot le-mekhoniyot; Mashehu lo normali; Gam hu ba-atsilim; Elef letsanim; ha-Holeh ha-medumeh; Maso shel Perishon; dated and undated, 1950s and 1960s.
Six miscellaneous theater programs, dated and undated, 1960s, 1970s, and 1980s.
Six miscellaneous theater programs, dated and undated, 1960s, 1970s, and 1980s.

Catalog from Bet Berl outlining programs and course offerings. 1957-1958 school year.

Three exams: Israel Ministry of Education and Culture exam in Hebrew language for unaccredited teachers, dated Summer, 1960; Tel Aviv University exam in Hebrew literature (for a course taught by Cohen's daughter Nurit Govrin), Dec. 1965 [two copies]; Israel Ministry of Education and Culture high school baccalaureate exam in Hebrew literature, dated Summer, 1967.

Tel Aviv University syllabus for course taught by Cohen's daughter Prof. Nurit Govrin: ha-Merkaz ha-sifruti ha-ivri be-artsot ha-berit [The Hebrew literary center in the United States]; first semester 1983; Source list for course taught by Dr. Gavriel Hayim Cohen: Mavo le-midrash ule-agadah, undated.

Tel Aviv University syllabus for course taught by Cohen's daughter Prof. Nurit Govrin: ha-Merkaz ha-sifruti ha-ivri be-artsot ha-berit [The Hebrew literary center in the United States]; first semester 1983;Source list for course taught by Dr. Gavriel Hayim Cohen: Mavo le-midrash ule-agadah, undated.
Single issues of 12 different serials. In Hebrew, dated 1862 to 1980s.
Single issue of Moshav Nahalal's newsletter, 1982.
Information sheet from the archive of ha-Mahon le-heker ha-tefutsot [Institute for Diaspora Studies] at Tel Aviv University, October, 1981.
Supplement for children from the daily newspaper Davar: vol. 17, no. 8; Nov. 28, 1946.
Newsletter published by the local council and the worker's council of the city of Eilat. Ca. 1957.
Newsletter published by the Harvard University Library; no. 325, May 8, 1975.
Iton rishmi [official newspaper]; contains the declaration of the establishment of the State of Israel. 3 p. No. 1, May 14, 1948.
Moznayim: shavuon li-sifrut, le-bikoret, ule-divre omanut [cultural journal published by the Union of Hebrew Writers in Palestine. No. 1 (201). Tel Aviv: Aug. 16, 1933.

did.unittitle: Serials: Nisan: measef arukh bi-yede Yaakov Fikhman. 1930.

scopecontent.p: Hebrew literary journal containing inscription by editor Yaakov Fikhman to David Shmuelevits. Warsaw: Spring, 1930.
Newsletter of Bet Berl college. Edited by Daniel Cohen-Sagi, May 1971.

Pamphlets from various political campaigns. Of special interest: six-page newsprint pamphlet with biographical information on 120 Mapai members [Workers' Party of Erets Yisrael] running for election to the Knesset, including David Ben Gurion and Moshe Dayan, ca. 1958.

Pamphlets for various political campaigns. Of special interest: six-page pamplet with biographical information on the 120 Mapai members [Workers' Party of Erets Yisrael], including David Ben Gurion and Moshe Dayan, ca. 1958.
